item.description: The game of PAH-TUM is played on a board of 7x7 squares. Like it's distant relatives Renju, Pente, Gomoku, Naughts and Crosses, and Tic-Tac-Toe, players alternate in an attempt to form collections of markers which score points. PAH-TUM game boards have been discovered in Mesopotamia and Assyria and a board fashioned in ivory was discovered in the tomb of Reny-Seneb, XII dynasty, and dated at roughly 1800 BC.

7 colored cubes/dice are rolled. When 4 of the same color show each player grabs the appropriate colored chip. The one that doesn't get a chip must slide the scoring slide to show 1 letter at a time until the words left out are revealed. The game continues until one player is left.

Bastion is a children's game where the aim is to be the first hero to reach the top of the tower, defeat the dark knight and rescue the maiden.
Each turn the hero climbs on step up the ladder, rolls the dice and moves the black knight the corresponding number of steps around the top of the tower pushing off the ladder on the square he lands on, causing the corresponding hero to fall down and begin his climb up the ladder anew.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Identical in concept to Monopoly, this game was created to showcase the City of Falls Church, VA and sponsored by the city itself - all proceeds were used to assist in Katrina relief. One drawback though is that it only supports 4 players.

name.value: Jul i Valhall: Jakten på Loke

item.description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Title: Christmas in Valhall: the Hunt for Loke

Come to Asgard and Valhall where Thor, Odin and the rest of the Nordic Gods rule

Loke has disappeared from the cave where the Gods chained him as punishment for the death of Balder. You fear that Loke will take his revenge and release Ragnarokk, so you must catch him as soon as possible with 3 chains and bring him back to the cave. Loke is as fast as the wind and not easy to catch, but follow and get help from the Gods in the hunt.

If you are really lucky, you find Lokes' key to Hel and may release Balder. Then you immediately may put two of your chains on Loke and get a good lead on your opponents.

But Loke is cunning, and you can not be safe with his capture. He may be stealing the magical apples in Valhall that gives him enough strength to free himself from the chains you have put on him. Are you the one to capture Loke and bring him all the way back to the cave?

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

"How to become a good poker player?"

Play "Helt Texas"! 
In the first round on the board - the Trivia round - you win chips by answering correctly to questions in three categories: General knowledge, Sport and entertainment and Poker.

After having won enough chips the game progresses into the Bluffing round. Now it's time to test the Pokerface! You challenge your opponents by stating yes/no questions on written statements about yourself.

The first player to qualify to the Finals in Poker, brings the players with oneself, and you play Texas Hold 'em.

2007 Nominert til Ã…rets Selskapsspill - Nominated for Party Game of the Year, Norway

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Tren Tanken = Exercise your mind

Now it's fun to learn history, geography and knowledge about society! "Tren Tanken" is a challenging and fun game - about the curriculum.

The team play game Tren Tanken presents new and intriguing learning strategies. The players work with maps and time lines, explains technical terms, structured concepts - or just answer questions. Tren Tanken can be played at school, as a part of the lessons - or at home. In addition to the cards with exercises and solutions, there are blank cards included that may be used to make exercises. The game is developed in Norway, in close relationship with pupils and teachers.

This edition is made for 10 year olds and up

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Tren Tanken = Exercise your mind

Now it's fun to learn history, geography and knowledge about society! "Tren Tanken Matriks" is a challenging and fun game - about the curriculum.

The team play game Tren Tanken presents new and intriguing learning strategies. The players work with maps and time lines, explains technical terms, structured concepts - or just answer questions. Tren Tanken can be played at school, as a part of the lessons - or at home. In addition to the cards with exercises and solutions, there are blank cards included that may be used to make exercises. The game is developed in Norway, in close relationship with pupils and teachers.

This edition is made for 12 year olds and up

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Bring your savings to the town which is full of funny stores.

You are attempting to buy as many stores as possible. The more stores you own, the more money you may make. Your opponents do have to pay rent when they stop there! If you are really lucky, and stop by a traffic light, you do not have to pay rent on your next move.

When all the stores have been bought, the player who first earns 30 coins wins.

(Translated from the box, in Danish)

Tænkestorm is a funny and engaging game that everybody can join!

The players are placing colored sticks in given patterns, either by adding or moving sticks every time it is their turn.

The players draw a thought card which depicts the figure the should make. It is the big color wooden die that determines the color of the sticks the players add or move. When a player succeeds in making the pattern on the card, he/she wins the thought card. The player who first wins 3 thought cards also wins the game.

(Translated from the box and homepage)

A Christian strategy game with witnessing obligation as its focus!

In Oppdrag: Misjon the participants will build missionary bases, upgrade them to congregations and churches around the world.

To be able to build one, one has to have access to resources. As the term strategy hints at, you need to be smart and make a strategic plan deciding where it's favorable to build missionaries, in order to secure the resources you need. One may suddenly be struck by drought catastrophes or a grasshopper invasion, so nothing is predictable.

The aim is to collect 5000 missionary points, but in addition answer questions from 3 of the information cards you have received during the game.

33 of the missionary organizations in Norway have written some information about their work and the countries where they evangelize in.

This game is clearly influenced by "The Settlers of Catan". The basic gameplay with rolling for reaources and using these to build various things is lifted straight off of Settlers.

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Title: the Kristiand Zoo

Tapi? Wilderbeast? Komodo dragon? Learn about animals from all over the world in this fun game!

The gamers are to visit animals around the world on a mission from the zoo. Participants will have to answer questions, mime and challenge the other players in duels.

You start with a mission card and have to visit 3 different continents. On each continent you visit you have to bring back a picture as evidence of your visit. Visit the lion in Africa, the tiger python in Asia and the alligator in America. There are also harmless animals around the world like pandas, sleuths and squirrel monkeys.

You will probably get the most headache from the kind, but very stubborn donkey you may meet. You better have brought a carrot as a bribe.

The player who first gets back to the zoo with 3 different animals from 3 different continents wins the game! Have you learned anything of the animals you have visited?

name.value: Elias: Spillet om den lille redningsskøyta

item.description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Title: Elias: the game of the little rescue boat

You have gotten a new rescue mission. A boat is in trouble out by the Galleskjærene!

As Elias you immediately have to travel from Lunvik to rescue the boat in trouble. Do you choose the short, but dangerous route through Skumlesund, or do you take the long, but safe route around?

You have to move as fast as possible around the sea, but suddenly you get an unexpected mission. Maybe you have to rescue Tråle out from Skumlesund, or pull Kruse off the rocks or deliver supplies to Storeblink.

Some of Elias' friends will also show up. Kjapp will help you in achieving the speed that you need, and Helinor brings you directly to the boat you want to rescue.

The player who rescues the most boats wins the game.

This game is based on a Norwegian television show for children - Elias.

Rolica is the second game in the ‘La Guerra de la Independencia’ series, following ‘Vimeiro’. Rolica covers the battle of the same name in August 1808 in Portugal during the Peninsular War between an army consisting of British, Spanish and Portuguese troops led by General Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, against a French army led by General Henri Delaborde.

name.value: Race for the Galaxy: Narodziny Imperiów

item.description:
2018 UPDATE: The second edition of the game is improved for color-blindness, includes 5 Retrofit Cards revised from the original versions, and 6 New Worlds promo homeworlds. The latter are both also available for purchase through the BGG store.

In the card game Race for the Galaxy, players build galactic civilizations by playing game cards in front of them that represent worlds or technical and social developments. Some worlds allow players to produce goods, which can be consumed later to gain either card draws or victory points when the appropriate technologies are available to them. These are mainly provided by the developments and worlds that are not able to produce, but the fancier production worlds also give these bonuses.

At the beginning of each round, players each select, secretly and simultaneously, one of the seven roles which correspond to the phases in which the round progresses. By selecting a role, players activate that phase for this round, giving each player the opportunity to perform that phase's action. For example, if one player chooses the settle role, each player has the opportunity to settle one of the planets from their hand. The player who has chosen the role, however, gets a bonus that applies only to them. But bonuses may also be acquired through developments, so you must be aware when another player also takes advantage of your choice of role.

item.description: From an interview with Trip Hawkins, founder of Electronic Arts, on gamasutra.com: "I designed the precursor to Madden Football in 1970 as a board game called Accu-Stat Pro Football." The article notes that this game was "his very first entrepreneurial effort, funded by a loan from his father."

item.description:
Longstreet's Assault simulates the attack of Major General John Bell Hood's division of Longstreet's corps against the Union left flank on the second day of fighting at Gettysburg, 2 July 1863. It covers the intense fighting at key sites such as Little Round Top, Devil's Den, the Slaughter Pen, and Bloody Run.

This is a tactical game where each unit represents either a regiment or an artillery battery. Each hex covers 125 yards. Restricted intelligence is used to simulate the fog of war and the oversized hexes are used to regulate movement. There are basic rules for the beginner and advanced rules for those that desire more detail. There is also a "what if scenario" of Hood's proposed flanking maneuver around the Union left.

item.description:
(From the included instructions...)

Let's Play Football was originated to give both the football player and the non-football player some of the thrills of football right in the home, in a car, on a plane, or anywhere.

The game is designed as a twosome - two people, or two teams playing against each other, at the same time, with one game. Let's Play Football can also be played singly.

Contents: 108 plastic-coated playing cards; printed football field; marker; instructions.

On the more than 60 different playing cards, the player discovers the Ometepe Island in the Great Nicaragua lake. Players then gather cards from different sectors such as animals, fruits, plants and life on Ometepe. The farther the game proceeds, the more difficult it gets to show all demand cards of one category.
The player who first succeeds in gathering the cards from 4 categories, wins the game and, hopefully, feels a lot like 'getting to know Ometepe'.

link.value: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss – Das Kartenspiel zum Film

item.description:
MOHO was a free cut and play game in issue 31 of Jeux sur un Plateau. (It even came with its own cut and fold box.)

The game itself is a scrabble like word game, where players add cards to cards already on the table.

The difference is that the each card has 1 of 8 different symbols. Each symbol represents 1 to 4 letters of the alphabet depending on its orientation.

The back thematic story is of the expedition by Professor Nemo Sogol where he discovers this unique alphabet.

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Undertitle: Experiences through generations

This game is a board game about every day life in Norway throughout the generations. Be entertained by the more than 2000 questions about everything from goat cheese to Bobbysocks, singing housewives to the Quartfestival, coffee supplements to ice cream.

Enjoying and funny questions about large and tiny events that involved everybody and has had a profound effect on the way we live our lives today.

The game is easy to learn and may be played again and again. The game is based around answering questions related to 252 of the country's best historical photos.

The game suits everybody who thinks it's fun to look back on events, people, products, trends and everyday stories that has made the our society. A family game for all generations and people of all ages.

Sit down with the family and be entertained by "The Norwegians own history".

Home Page: http://www.egenhistorie.no/

name.value: The Fox and the Hound Game

item.description: This very simple children's game based on the Disney film of the same name is essentially a spin and move game with minor strategy involving a second dial located under the spinner which gauges if you can move friend or foe.

The goal of the game is assemble rocket parts, a crew and some cargo on the Moon and launch.

Basic rules:
Each turn a player picks up a card. If they are able to lay down cards that total eleven (including at least one 1), then they are able to declare takeoff. Subsequent turns allow the player to move closer to the Moon with their rocket parts, crew or cargo. On arriving at the Moon, they need 11 to get back. This journey has to be undertaken 7 times to win. There is a lot of luck in how the cards fall. However it works for young children learning to count.

Plus rules:
Much like the basic game, except that the game now has Bad Weather (to prevent a takeoff or landing), Meteor Showers (to cause missed turns) and Engine Trouble (to slow down the journey). Of course each problem comes with a solution, Clear Skies, Meteor Shield and Repair Engine.

2*Plus rules:
Bad Weather can either cause a delayed takeoff (one missed turn) or delayed takeoff until Clear Skies are found.

3*Plus rules:
There are two spy cards, these cards can abort an Earth takeoff completely.

4*Plus rules:
The spies become one for the Moon and one for the Earth. Aborting an Earth takeoff just delays the journey. Aborting a Moon landing makes the entire journey useless, and they still have to get back to Earth to start another journey.

5*Plus rules:
Either the journey cards are played like Gin Rummy, when a set is complete, or the journey can be accumulated as they are in Mille Bornes

The game played at 4*Plus can take well over 4 hours, with each Spy testing the best of friendships.

At first glance, this game appears to be a multi-player variant on earlier games in the vein of L'Attaque. Players set up pieces of hidden value, advance them, and capture opponents pieces by moving into occupied spaces and having the piece of greater rank.

However, there are other differences beyond the multi-player capability. Players do not seek a hidden flag; rather, they strive to reach visible target spaces in their opponents' territories that may only be occupied by a Spy piece. Challenging is optional; i.e., multiple players may have pieces co-exist on the same space as long as a player moving in declines to ask, "Who's there?" Finally, each player has a piece that cannot be captured called the Secret Police, which may only capture an opponent's Spy.

The first player to move his Spy onto an opponent's Palace space or Coat of Arms space is the winner.

From box:

"In 1862 congress passed the Homestead Act. A United States citizen twenty-one years old could file a claim on 160 acres of public land which he wished to own as a home for himself and his family. If he lived there for five years, had built a house and was raising crop, he was given title to the land."

"The country was wild, the problems faced by the "sod-busters" were great. Many homesteaders gave up before five years had passed. Everyone who succeeded did so through sheer determination and by using every skill or handicraft he could master."

Players take turns drawing cards and playing them onto their Land Tracts. The cards come in 5 colors, one for each year. At the end of the game, players who have a house, crop, and 4 of the 6 other types of cards, without having the claim jumper card, win.

item.description: Covers the battle of Arginussae, the Athenian naval victory over Sparta in 405BC. It uses the same game system as the game designer's earlier effort, Salamis. Like the earlier 'monster' DTP game, Arginussae has nearly a thousand counters (albeit most of them are status markers) and eight maps. Like Salamis, this is a limited edition game - only 75 copies were printed.

This is a monster DTP wargame. It has individual ships for the whole battle (some 2,300 counters) and 28 maps, which come out at about 8 by 4 feet. Victory is determined when one side's fleets have all broken. This involves a dice roll for each fleet each turn matched to how many triremes they have lost.

Only 50 copies were produced.

Blackout predates American involvement in, but not awareness of, World War II. In this game, players roll dice and cover (or "black out") the matching spaces of their respective cities. The first player to fully cover his city announces "BLACKOUT" and wins the game. Counters are also provided in case the players wish to play a series of games, with each player losing one counter per uncovered space to the victor.

As the dice only passes from one player to another when he is unable to use his roll to cover spaces in his city (and another player *can* use that roll to do so), it is possible for a player to win on his first turn. In that case the, payout for the multi-game series is limited to five counters.

Blackout appeared in both the traditional narrow box (folded board) and wide box (unfolded board) formats.

Mondoes is a rummy-like set collection game.
The 112 card set is made up of 4 suits each with two numbers.
The object of the game is to earn points by playing pairs of cards that score points by matching suit and matching numbers. (Matching numbers can be identical or sequential)

Players draw and discard until one player thinks they have a high enough score and calls "Mondoes". Other players can challenge the call if they believe they have a higher hand.

The game ends when one player has obtained 250 points.

Played on a game board that represents a stepped pyramid, the object of Ziggurat is create equations by placing the dice rolled on the board. Players score points whenever they place a die , such that when added to a adjacent die they add up to 7. You can also score points for equations involving 3 dice. The equations can use addition or subtraction.

A clash of Scottish Clansmen. In Kilt players bump, bash and run past your opponents clans. The goal is to grab the rock that starts in the center of the board and dump it in your opponents well.

Components include:

1 16x16 board on a vinyl playing mat, 20 clan pieces and 1 rock.

Les Apprentis de la Manufacture is the first game from producers L'Auberge des Jeux.
Each player take the role of a manufacture, attempting to create Jouy fabrics to gain the rank of Royal Manufacture by Queen Marie-Antoinette. Each turn players can visit the Market, the Auction House or the Artists' House, in order to buy goods, create fabrics or hire artists. The player who creates the most valuable fabrics will win the game.
The game consists of illustrated fabric boards and cards. A supply of 'Ecu' (paper money) is also provided.
The production is richly illustrated and has tonnes of thematic flavor and text information.

Castle Cannon Shoot is a two- to four-player shooting-gallery game in which the object is to fire all your fire “cannon balls” into the courtyard of the rotating castle.

Each player selects eight marble-like “cannon balls” of one color and places them in their own shooting alley. The castle is set spinning, and all players simultaneously attempt to shoot their cannon balls up an inclined ramp between the rotating ramparts into the castle.

The trick for players is to time their shots to avoid the ramparts of the rotating castle.

As soon as a player has used all their cannon balls, they close their own gate to avoid any other player shooting into their alley.

The object of this card game, based on the Robert Altman film, changes from winning the most rounds you can in the High Game to losing the most rounds you can in the Low Game. The Dealer always decides on a High or Low Game depending on the value of the cards he holds in his hands. You are awarded points after each game is played only if you have won or lost a specific number of rounds. Capture the one and only Spinach Card and you will win a point for it alone. The first player to score 10 points wins the game.

There are 40 playing cards divided into 4 color-coded and character-themed suits numbered 1-10: Red Olive Oyl, Blue Swee' Pea, Purple Bluto and Yellow Popeye along with 1 Spinach card.

Long-winded rules that basically boils down to a slightly more extensive version of 'war'. Players lay down cards, highest value card within a suit wins, etc.

name.value: Maze of the Red Mage: A Solitaire Dungeon Adventure!

item.description:
…You awaken in a small shadowy chamber lit only by a fiery brazier…a deep voice from a shimmering red figure intones “You will plague me no longer! You have interfered in my plans for far too long. You claim to be a hero? Well then… let’s put you to the test! I have entombed you inside my maze…can you escape and prove yourself worthy of the title hero? If you can escape my maze before sunrise I shall leave your lands forever…

Maze of the Red Mage is a solitaire dungeon adventure game. Your goal is to defeat the Red Mage by escaping before the sunrises! If the Sun rises or you die in the maze, the Red Mage will rule your lands forever!

The dungeon is set up randomly face down using tiles. A blend of the classic PC games Minesweeper and Rogue Maze of the Red Mage includes: variable creatures, treasures, dungeon design and characters making every game different! It includes rules to level up your character as well, all in a quick re-playable lunchtime escape!

Educational Math board game that uses checkers type movement. The playing pieces called a "Tivit" are 6 sided dice with each side having a symbol and numerical value.

The 2 players race to reach the 9 ending positions. Each position has a mathematical operation(addition, subtraction, multiplication or division, fractions, square roots, and percentages). A players score is the value of their tivit adjusted for the math operation.

The most advanced of the Tivitz series of games, this version adds square roots, fractions, decimals, and percentages.
 The game includes 30 different paper boards with varying degrees of difficulty. For ages 8 and up.

name.value: Winnie the Pooh Friends of the Forest Game

item.description:
Winnie the Pooh : Friends of the Forest Game
2-4 Players 
Ages 5+

Overview
Down in the Hundred Acre Wood, Pooh and his friends have fallen on hard times. The once crystal blue river has long since clogged up with rubbish and the trees which provide warmth and shelter for the animals are fast disappearing. 
Woozles and Heffalumps are mischievous creatures, who wreak havoc in the wood chopping down trees, tossing rubbish in the river and generally making a nuisance of themselves.
Your task is to help Pooh clean the river and plant three trees.

Contents
1 Playing Area
27 Pooh Cards
28 Woozle Cards
4 Wooden Playing Pieces 
1 Wooden Spinner (Top & Bottom) 
12 Self Assembly Interlocking Trees
12 Jigsaw River Sections
2 Interlocking Woodland Sections
1 Dice

Object of the Game
To be the first player to clean up the river and plant three trees in his/her area

Gameplay
Players roll a die and move around the board planting trees and cleaning river sections.

When a player lands on a Spin the cloud space the weather cloud is spun and effects are applied to the players areas

Sunny – Take a tree
Stormy – Lose a tree but clean a river section
Pollution – Lose a tree and a clean river section
Gloomy – Your area is unaffected

Trees and Rivers can also be lost and gained through cards and other board spaces

From the press release:

Combining word searching with vocabulary building, Obscurity has players search a letter board for 10 words hidden on a game card(4 letters or longer). Words may be formed in any direction as long as the letters touch for every word a player got that their opponents did not, they get to score points. Players use a word list on the back of the card to score their words, the longer the word the higher the score.

Includes 80 double sided game cards, game board with storage area.

name.value: Mäh und Muh wo ist die Kuh?

item.description: In Crazy Creatures players try and connect and match 3-D animal body parts to create cows, horses, pigs or sheep. Each player begins with a mid section and then players take turns rolling and moving around the board. If they land on a barn they press the barn button and listen for the animal sound. Then they collect a part from the matching animal. Some locations ask them to trade parts with other players, get new parts from the pasture or lose a part and return it to the pasture.

item.description:
From the Press Release:

In this fun color recognition game, players spin the spinner in the hopes of shooing their color coordinated critters to another player's sleeve or back to their home in the "garden". The first player to send all of his or her bugs flying is the winner.

An educational game that helps early learners follow directions, including the difference between left and right and teaches color matching.

Give Peace A Chance: A Game of International Relations and Conflict Resolution

Publisher:
"The purpose of the game is to challenge players to think about global interdependence. Lively discussions ensue by both young and old as the game takes on new meaning when players choose different countries to represent."

Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the castle. That player must use the Magic Arrow to cross the castle moat. Each player must answer Reading Between the Lines questions along the way."

item.description:
2-5 players control their own apiary. The goal is to build the largest and best apiary - the first player to get 10 points wins.

Honey War is loosely based on real beekeeping, and includes many of the same problems and solutions real beekeepers face.

The game consists of a board, bee cards (queens and workers), pollen cards, honey cards and action cards. On a players turn they roll the dice and move that number of spaces around the board, collecting special cards as they land on the relevant spaces. These cards are used to get new bees, inflict disease on other players hives, or cure your own infected hives.

Combat Commander:Pacific is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the Pacific Theater of World War II. CC:P's main theme is the addition of three new factions to the Combat Commander family:

 Imperial Japan
 the Pacific US - with a strong emphasis on the US Marine Corps
 the Pacific Commonwealth - focusing on Indian and ANZAC forces




CC:P is a stand alone game in the card-driven Combat Commander game series. While utilizing Combat Commander: Europe's basic rules, CC:P includes numerous rule tweaks and additions in order to more accurately portray tactical warfare as experienced by the participants in and around the Pacific and Indian Oceans. This slightly ramps up the complexity of the Combat Commander series while at the same time imparting a bit more depth and realism. Just a few of the additions include:

Banzai attacks;
BARs and Thompson SMGs;
Beach landings & river crossings;
Hidden movement;
Caves;
Scouts;
Aircraft;
Bayonets;
Mortar spotting;
Treetop snipers;
Reconnoitering.

SCALE: Each hex of a Combat Commander map is roughly 100 feet across (about 30 meters). Each complete Player Turn abstractly represents several seconds of real time. Each complete Game Turn abstractly represents several minutes of real time.

UNITS: Due in part to the unique composition of late-war USMC squads and the imbedding of specialized weapon teams within IJA squads, the units in the game are represented by 4-6 man Teams and 8-13 man Squads. Radios — and individual weapons larger than a rifle — are represented by their own counters. Individual Aircraft are also represented with their own counters.

VICTORY: Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent’s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible. The degree to which a player succeeds or fails is measured by a scenario’s specific Objective chits, the destruction of enemy units, and the exiting of friendly units off the opponent’s board edge.

GAME FLOW: A game of Combat Commander is divided into several Time segments. There is no sequence of play to follow, however: each Time segment is divided into a variable number of Player Turns, each of which may consist of one or more Fate Card "Orders" conducted by the active player. Fate Card "Actions" may generally be conducted by either player at any time. "Events" and die roll "Triggers" — both good and bad — will occur at random intervals to add a bit of chaos and uncertainty to each player’s perfect plan.

CC:P includes twelve maps featuring terrain specific to the PTO.

CC:P's playbook includes:

 twelve scenarios.
 Pacific version of the Random Scenario Generator utilizing the new maps and nationalities. This random scenario system provides an almost unending variety of map configurations, force structures, and combat situations.
 section detailing the differences between CC:P and Combat Commander's first two volumes in order that players familiar with those earlier games can jump right into their first scenario with minimal rules reading.
 examples of play.
 Design & Development notes as well as numerous play hints.




Components:

 352x large counters (5/8") 
 280x small counters (1/2") 
 220x 2.5 x 3.5 cards 
 6x 2-sided 17 x 22 maps (twelve maps in total)
 3x 2-sided 8.5 x 11 nation-specific player aid sheets 
 2x 1-sided 8.5 x 11 generic player aid sheets 
 1x 32-page Rulebook
 1x 32-page Playbook
 1x Track Display




NOTE: Combat Commander:Pacific is a stand-alone game. You do NOT need to own any other Combat Commander game in order to play it, though familiarity with the system would be a plus.

link.value: Combat Commander: Battle Pack #4 – New Guinea

item.description:
The game consists of a small board with 5x6 holes, some marbles and a "marble launcher" made of wood. 
The point is to use the marble launcher and shoot the marbles on the board, trying to hit the holes to score points. 
The holes give different points, ranging from 5 points for easiest holes to hit to 100 points for the hole in the center of the board.

This is Damm game number 324, probably published sometime in the 1950's.

A deduction game based around the idea that spies send messages to each other using personal ads.

Players are dealt cards that indicate gender, age, and personality traits (romantic, sporty, good looking), and then take turns reading from personal ads (either actual or with the included samples) and revealing how many of their traits appear in the given ad.

Home Page: http://members.aol.com/seekagentx/

name.value: John Ridgways' Round the World Yacht Race Game

item.description:
John Ridgways' Round the World Yacht Race Game
2-6 Players
Ages 10-adult

From the introduction in the rule book:
Members of the crew have spent long hours developing this ingenious Round the world Yacht Race game. It reproduces many of the hazards and strokes of good fortune that the sailor faces in such a venture. The handicap system gives a fair chance to everyone.

Contents
1 Game Board (in 3 pieces)
30 Luck Cards
30 Hazard Cards
6 Plastic Yachts
2 Dice(1 Red, 1 Blue)
6 Yacht Cards
7 Score Sheets (Wipe clean)

Object of the Game
Select a yacht and sail it around the world in the fastest possible time, collecting the minimum handicap score.

Gameplay
Players select 6 ports that they will visit on their circumnavigation.

The two die are use to determine movement (Red = North/South, Blue = East/west) and moves may be completed in any order: the only restriction is that you may not double back

Handicap points are gained from:
a)the yacht itself
b)hazard cards
c)every turn taken after the first boat arrives back in Portsmouth
d)the cost of the yacht 
e)ignoring dice rolls/moving only part of a roll

Hazard and luck cards are gained from wind systems and pressure zones

At the end of the game the yacht with the lowest score wins

THE KAISERS PIRATES™ is a fast-paced card game of gripping adventure on the high seas set during World War One. Players control some of Kaiser Wilhelm’s ace German converted commerce-raiders and light cruisers. Air patrols were in their infancy and it was still easy to disappear into the vast expanses of the high seas only to re-emerge on another key sea lane. Players use their raiders in the traditions of the privateers and pirates of old to sink or capture as many Allied and neutral merchantmen as possible. Danger lurks everywhere but, in a desperate pinch, these ships can shoot it out with the British hunters.

In its unique game play system each player commands both the German and British Forces as they scour the sea-lanes in search of their next merchant prize. No opponent available or just looking to sharpen game-play strategies? THE KAISERS PIRATES™ solitaire game system has everything needed.

 THE KAISERS PIRATES™ includes:


 One 20-Card German Raider/Warship Deck: Historic German commerce raiders
 One 60-Card Merchantman Deck: Historic victims of the German raiders
 One 100-Card Action Deck: The cards used in attacking and defending the ship cards. GMT Games release includes the expansion cards
 One 20-Card Solitaire Action Deck: The cards used when playing the game solitaire
 Eight dice, 2 x 4/8-sided, 2 x 6-sided, 2 x 8-sided and 2 x 10-sided, along with 16 wooden markers
 Action Card summary foldout
 The Complete Rules of Play, all in color and profusely illustrated
 Number of Players: One to four

item.description:
Lawn Darts is quite simply a game about playing lawn darts indoors.

Harken back to the good old days when you had a 2 foot long dart that you threw or tossed at a small plastic yellow or red ring. (and incidentally maybe at your friends toes or random appendages). Relive the summer fun with this quick mini reproduction of the game.

Please note... this is not the real thing... if you were to be playing this game... well there is not a foot and half long metal dart flying through the air. We use smaller magnetic tipped darts and our field of green is a felt field with rings backed by a magnetic strip. The essence of the game is still the same... get it in the rings. But if you want a bit of danger well we've included two felt feet as well... impale one with a dart and you lose points. Finish the round without sticking a dart into the tender tootsies... and you'll find your score climbs up a bit more.

If you have any questions... well I'm (mbourgeois) the guy to ask. We don't forsee production on this game anytime soon. There simply isn't the current market for it. However if you'd like to make your own... just ask for info and we'll send off the material requirements and measurements to make your own.

See: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/2279107#2279107

The players are skiing in the mountains,competing about who will be the first one getting to the big cabin on top of the mountain. 
A children's game learning the players common sense in the mountain.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Brighton and Hove, in the United Kingdom.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Birmingham, in the United Kingdom.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bath, in the United Kingdom.

This game simulates the Battle of Iwo Jima fought in February and March 1945 between the Marines and the Imperial Forces of the Empire of Japan. The main scenario has the Marines landing where they did historically, South Beach. A variant has the Marines landing on West Beach. Another variant allows the American player to bring on one or two reserve Marine regiments but having to give the Japanese five victory points for each regiment. Includes rules for solitaire play.

431 meters/hex, 3 days/turn, company.

One 11x17-inch game map, 140 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out, charts and tables, rules.

This small, but very competitive game on the first clash between the French-Piedmontese army and the Austrian one in May 1859 during the first phases of the campaign known as the Second Italian War for Independence, is an almost skirmish battle fought on the country roads and the fields near Voghera, on the road from Piedmont towards Milano. It was an harsh battle, where the Austrians got the numerical advantage but didn’t have the confidence to use it as it was due for a victory.
The simple, but not simplistic rules integrate movement and combat, several readiness status for the various leaders and troops present on the field of battle, fire and melee rules, morale, territorial gains and so on. The sumptous graphics for both the map and the counters make this one a joy for the eyes.

Components:
1 8.5" by 11" map 
64 counters 
Rulebook
Charts

Released as Print-n-Play in June 2007.

name.value: I Obey: The Campaign of Bezzecca 1866

item.description:
I Obey – the Campaign of Bezzecca 1866
This one is an operational game on Garibaldi campaign over the Alps during the initial and central phases of the Third Italian War of Independence. It was a strange, fascinating campaign by one of the most famous generals of his time, not only in Italy. Garibaldi’s red shirts fought and won against a superior, but very dispersed Austrian army, that tried to force Garibaldi to a slow and depressing struggle over mountain passes and cliffs, but was surprised in the decisive battle of Bezzecca that opened the road to victory for the Italian general that was stopped by a direct order of his king (to which he responded simply “I obey”, giving up a sure victory on the field for a political one for his country).

With a very peculiar chit drawing activation method and a combat system that stresses fatigue over real casualties, I obey is a fascinating study of this neglected campaign, with a see-saw motion of the counters over the splendid map and the chance for both sides to gain an unexpected victory.

Medium complexity, 2/3 hours playing time, both for competitive and solitaire play.

Released as Print-n-Play in June 2007

CCG based on the French/Chinese anime series Dragon Hunters.
Players pick a character and try to defeat monsters in the categories strength, cleverness and wisdom using their Goldons (money) to buy support.

Each player choose a pole and inserts its plain end into the base of the same color. He then positions a monkey so that the stick between its hands rests on the fourth knob from the bottom.

The youngest player throws the die and the others follow in turn. Move your monkey as many steps as dots - green up, red down.

The monkey which reaches the top of the pole first is the winner !

Players compete in a ski resort to be the most popular one.

Published in Jeux & stratégie Nouvelle Formule #2

An abstract strategy game on the theme of sheep herds in the mountains. Each player has sheep, dog and eagle pieces. They start on one side of the map and must be the first to reach the opposite side.

Published in Jeux & stratégie Nouvelle Formule #3.

Publisher:

item.description:
Based on the hit Australian TV show of the 1990s, Gladiator.

This is a board game for 2 to 4 players, using the die and a counter for each player.

Move around the board and be the first to finish having faced the test of the Gladiators.

Watch out for Condor, Vulcan, Rebel, Tower and Cougar along the way.
Another Game of the ??? series. Roll and move, collect sets of three identical counters. The player with the most sets in the end wins.

It is early morning at the fish market and it is already alive with fish-mongers pushing their fishy products. The fish-mongers loudly praise their fresh fish as they try to attract as many of the numerous customers as possible.

"This is your lucky day! It is good that you have come by, for I can offer you 2 flounder and 1 shark for just € 10!" But only the fastest players will get the best deals, but move too fast and you may pay too much.

Actually, the players are both the sellers and the buyers. As you might expect, looking as sellers to get the highest prices and as buyers the lowest.

The player who earns the most money wins the game.

The original title of this game is Fangfrisch (e.g. a fresh catch), but the English language name for it is Cash-a-Catch.

name.value: Konarmiya Year of the Red Tide

item.description:
Konarmiya Year of the Red Tide is a simulation game of the battles between Soviet Russia and the Republic of Poland during the Summer of 1920. The Game is for two players who respectively play the roles of M.N. Tukhachevsky, commander of the Soviet forces (the Red player) and Josef Pilsudski, commander of the Polish forces (the White player).

The game uses the same system as Freikorps with 192 counters and a map covering from Warsaw to Kiev.

Rules include random events, morale, air power, two CRT tables (regular and shock), elite troops and much more...

In this game, you vie to be the first to play all your cards. The game components consist of a deck of 81 cards, each with a different combination of shape, number, pattern and color.

Each player is dealt 7 cards, and one card is placed face up. One player rolls the die and the each player tries to be the first to play a card, matching the trait that the die indicates. The player who played the card takes the die and rolls it. The first player to run out of cards wins the hand. The first player to win two hands wins the game.

Invented by 9 year old Lindsay Berstein, winner of the National Young Game inventors Contest.

The object of the game is to be the first to fill your Rapunzel braid up with color form braid pieces.

For ages 4 and up.

Battleague is a collectible miniatures game produced by Mattel. It uses a combat system similar to Attacktix Battle Figure Game Marvel Superheroes. Figures are eliminated by physically knocking them over using the physical abilities of other figures (i.e. shooting projectiles, punching, etc). More advanced rules exist that include mission cards and power chips.

From the publisher:

This the latest action-figure board game (without the board) by Mattel. Using beautifully sculpted figures by the Four Horsemen, kids can build their armies of heroes and villains with booster packs, and set up elaborate play environments thanks to packaging that actually transforms into city buildings.

Battleague Starter Set: Kids can battle like a hero with Battleague the new action figure board game, but without the board. The starter set includes everything kids need to gear up for battle, including four beautifully-sculpted figures, mission cards with four power chips and two tokens. All Battleague packages convert into battlefield buildings, from city hall to banks and more. Battleague offers many different games in one, including mission play, last man standing and first to score 10 battle blows.

$9.99 Age: 7+ Available: July 2007

Battleague Booster Set: The Battleague Booster Set expands the play of Battleague by adding new heroes and villains to one’s army of action figures. Each booster pack includes two surprise figures, a mission card, four power chips and two tokens. Additionally, each booster box converts into a building to help players create the ultimate urban battlefield.

Commissions
The Real Estate Game
Each player is a real estate sales representative trying to earn $1,000,000 to win the game. It is a simple roll and move game where you work your way around the board listing, buying, selling and renting properties

You and Your Fundie brothers and sisters use different Relics to kill the Hippies.

Each of 2-6 players leads members of the fanatical religious 
right in their Holy Crusade to rid the world of those dirty hippies.

At a party or at a pub, play Kill the Hippies. It’s a card game for everyone: sinner or saint (but to have a Bible helps!) Choose the length of the game; you and your friends in faith select how many Hippies there is time to deal with. Players can Convert or Kill with various mundane and religious relics. Conversions are always worth more points. But Events sometimes occur that help the Hippies...damn you KARMA! 
Remember, God is judging you. (Rom 12:19)

item.description:
A classic game of shipping, first published in the 1950s.

The players are shipping magnates sending their ship around the world to bring goods like coffee from Brazil, rice from Siam and oil from Venezuela to the Scandinavian market at the best price possible.

With its hex-based game board, changing market price for the goods and the players’ freedom of where to go, Shipping is quite an advanced game and leaves more to be decided by the players then what's normal for games of this period.

The original version is marked Damm game 387 and was published in the 1950s. There must have been at least two print runs, as some game boxes has the publisher’s logo in a white field, others in a yellow, but no variation in the game contents have been observed between these.

Confusingly, when the publisher made a Norwegian translation of the similar (and possibly related) Swedish game Wangaratta in the 1970s, they reused the name Shipping for this.

From the RPGNow listing:

Crack Whore is a solitaire adventure dice game where you play the character of a prostitute who is trying to escape the street life. Of course, to accomplish this you need to save up some considerable money; and that means working the streets. Will your pimp, drugs, diseases, and guys that like to hack apart street walkers stand in your way to achieving a better life?

Multi player option allows for more than one person to play at a time, competing to see who is the first to escape the streets and win the game. Can you escape the desperate life of the streets before they put you six feet under?

-- 7 Pages. Includes game rules and character sheets.

You will also need a D6 to play this game.

item.description:
A selection from the included English rules of the game "Croc' Toutous" by Janod Jeux of France -

"Contents:
Two cute wooden doggie shakers and 18 numbered dome-shaped doggie bites.

Setup:
Turn over all the Doggie Bites to hide the figures.

Rules:
Each player covers one doggie bite with his doggie shaker. The players then shake their doggie vigorously on the table for a few seconds, and lift to see what they scored. The doggie bite will have turned over to show th numbered side as it was shaken. The player with the higher number takes the piece from the other player

The game ends when there are no more doggie bites, and the winner is the person who collects the most bites."

Suitable for Ages 4 and up, this game familiarizes children with numbers and introduces them to simple sums (in an advanced variant).

Matchroom
Snooker Quiz Game
The general knowledge quiz that scores like snooker.
Ages 8 and up
2 - 4 Players

Players answer questions of varying degrees of difficult
Red = easiest
Black = hardest
When a question is answered correctly the player may pocket a ball on the mini snooker table and then choose another color to answer. 
Points for each ball are the same as in the game of snooker

Based on the ITV Quiz Game

Super Blockbusters
2+ Players
Ages 16 and up

Players/Teams must make an unbroken connection between their two outside colors. White plays vertically, Blue plays horizontally. 
Tiles can be placed by correctly answering questions and filing in the letter hexes with the players color.

The game also includes the Gold Run which is played by the winner.

Contents
Blockbusters Playing Screen
2400 Block busters Questions; 200 question cards, 120 Questions for each letter (20 Letters)
2000 Gold Run Questions; 100 Questions Cards, 10 Questions per Gold Run
5 Yellow Letter Strips
51 Hexagonal Playing Pieces, 17 Blue, 17 White, 17 Yellow
1 Sand Timer
1 Die

name.value: How to Host a Teen Mystery: Roswell That Ends Well

item.description:
You are invited to attend a luau and all-night star gazing party at Allen Ian Abduxion's Point Doom beach house. But when you arrive, you discover that someone at the party has been involved in extra-terrestrial foul play. As you assume the role of one of these eight suspicious characters and solve the mystery, you and your guests will enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward blackmail, deceit and conspiracy.

Characters: Ariel LeSalt, Dexter Terrestrial, Endira DeWorley, Klaus N. Counter, Twyla Zoan, "Speed-O" Leitner, Carey O'Reagun, Koushpa Tater

name.value: The Curse of the Ruby Rhino

item.description: Behold the Ruby Rhino! The most coveted of ancient treasures stands inches from your grasp but a curse makes it nearly impossible to capture. Roll the dice and try your best to corner this elusive jeweled beast. Watch out for a bevy of fake gold that will get in your way. Hang onto the ruby rhino all by itself and you've not only broken the curse — you've won the game!

name.value: Mailbox: A Treasure Hunt Party Game

item.description:
The object of Mailbox is to be the letter carrier who delivers the most letters to animals' mailboxes. The game utilizes a dealer or leader to facilitate game play.

The game consists of 8 mailboxes, each with 4 animals' names and pictures on them, and several sheets of letters, which are to be delivered. The leader writes each players initials on a letter, distributes them to the appropriate players. Players search for the appropriate animal's mailbox, deposit their letter, and return to the leader for another letter to deliver, continuing until all letters are delivered. The winner is the player who delivers the most letters to the correct mailboxes.

Publisher: 
"The object of the game is to be the first player to answer five questions correctly by landing on the right answer letter on each level."
